# UIActivityIndicatorView

**Class**

A view that shows that a task is in progress.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class UIActivityIndicatorView
```

## Overview

You control when an activity indicator animates by calling the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivityIndicatorView/startAnimating()] and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivityIndicatorView/stopAnimating()] methods. To automatically hide the activity indicator when animation stops, set the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivityIndicatorView/hidesWhenStopped] property to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].

You can set the color of the activity indicator by using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivityIndicatorView/color] property.

## Creating an activity indicator

- **init(style:)**: Creates an activity indicator.
- **init(frame:)**: Creates an activity indicator with the specified frame rectangle.
- **init(coder:)**: Creates an activity indicator from data in an unarchiver.

## Managing an activity indicator

- **startAnimating()**: Starts the animation of the progress indicator.
- **stopAnimating()**: Stops the animation of the progress indicator.
- **isAnimating**: A Boolean value indicating whether the activity indicator is currently running its animation.
- **hidesWhenStopped**: A Boolean value that controls whether the activity indicator is hidden when the animation is stopped.

## Configuring the activity indicator appearance

- **style**: The basic appearance of the activity indicator.
- **color**: The color of the activity indicator.

## Constants

- **UIActivityIndicatorView.Style**: The visual style of the progress indicator.

## Content views

- **UICalendarView**: A view that displays a calendar with date-specific decorations, and provides for user selection of a single date or multiple dates.
- **UIContentUnavailableView**: A view that indicates there’s no content to display.
- **UIImageView**: A view that displays a single image or a sequence of animated images in your interface.
- **UIPickerView**: A view that uses a spinning-wheel or slot-machine metaphor to show one or more sets of values.
- **UIProgressView**: A view that depicts the progress of a task over time.
